summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing a new civil lawsuit filed against Jeffrey Epstein by a 16-year-old Virginia girl, represented by attorney Jeffrey Herman. The emails reference Epstein's 2006 arrest and an upcoming status hearing, and the prosecutors note the new plaintiff is likely not one of 'our girls' from their criminal case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Billionaire and part-time Palm Beach resident facing a second civil lawsuit for alleged sexual abuse of a minor at his mansion; was arrested in 2006 on a felony solicitation of prostitution charge.

persons.name: Jeffrey Herman
persons.context: Attorney representing the 16-year-old Virginia girl (Jane Doe No. 2) in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein; filed a $50 million federal lawsuit in late January 2008 and planned a news conference.

persons.name: Nancy Â°then
persons.context: Author of the Sun-Sentinel.com article about the new lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein, which is referenced in the email chain.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Mentioned in the first email as a possible source of 'vaguely threatening communications'; specific identity and role are not detailed.

connections.description: Herman is the attorney filing civil lawsuits on behalf of alleged victims against Epstein.

events.title: Second Civil Lawsuit Filed Against Epstein
events.description: A 16-year-old Virginia girl, represented by attorney Jeffrey Herman, files a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein alleging sexual assault and intentional infliction of emotional distress, seeking damages similar to a prior $50 million suit.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on a felony charge of solicitation of prostitution.

events.title: First Federal Lawsuit Filed
events.description: A $50 million federal lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein in late January 2008 by attorney Jeffrey Herman on behalf of another alleged victim.

events.title: Upcoming Status Hearing
events.description: Epstein is scheduled to appear in court for a status hearing related to his 2006 criminal case.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: A second civil lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein on February 6, 2008, by a 16-year-old Virginia girl alleging sexual abuse at his mansion.
The lawsuit claims Epstein has a sexual 'obsession for underage minor girls' and sought economically disadvantaged girls for paid massages that turned sexual.
Epstein was arrested in 2006 on a felony solicitation of prostitution charge and had a status hearing scheduled for March 2008.
Assistant U.S. Attorneys communicating via email indicate the new plaintiff is likely not one of 'our girls' from their ongoing criminal investigation.
Attorney Jeffrey Herman, who filed a $50 million lawsuit in January 2008, also represents this new plaintiff and planned a news conference in West Palm Beach.
